alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 1:27PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Calhoun and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 127 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orangeburg, Brookdale, St. Matthews, Edisto Gardens, Claflin College, South Carolina State University, Orangeburg County Airport, North, Cameron, Neeses, Norway, Rowesville, Cordova, Livingston, Cope, Prince of Orange Mall, Edisto, Wilkinson Heights and Creston. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 132 and 152. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
